data.title: Amanda Bynes List of Movies and TV Shows
data.meta_description: Check out Amanda Bynes full list of movies and tv shows. Find out everything about Amanda Bynes latest movies and best tv shows.
data.text:
Amanda Bynes is a well-known actress who has appeared in a variety of popular movies and TV shows. Who rose to fame as a star on Nickelodeon in the 1990s and early 2000s. She was born in Thousand Oaks, California, on April 3, 1986.

She began acting at seven years old. Her first acting job was in a TV commercial for Buncha Crunch candy. As a child, Amanda also performed in stage plays like “Annie,” “The Music Man,” and “The Sound of Music.” She was discovered at a comedy camp in Los Angeles by a Nickelodeon producer.

Amanda was cast in “All That,” a show on Nickelodeon that she was part of from 1996 to 2000. She then starred in “The Amanda Show,” a spinoff from 1999 to 2002, and was in “Figure It Out” from 1997 to 1999. She acted with Jennie Garth in the sitcom “What I Like About You” on WB from 2002 to 2006.

Her first big movie was “Big Fat Liar” in 2002, when she was 16. Amanda starred in several more movies in the 2000s like “What a Girl Wants” in 2003, “She’s the Man” in 2006, “Hairspray” and “Sydney White” in 2007, and “Easy A” in 2010.

We’ll take a look at some of her best movies and TV shows. This article provides a comprehensive list of Amanda Bynes movies and TV shows, showcasing her versatile talent and creative vision.

Who is Amanda Bynes?

Amanda Laura Bynes was born on April 3, 1986, in Thousand Oaks, California. She is the youngest of three children, with her mother, Lynn, a dental assistant, and her father, Richard, a dentist. Amanda’s acting career began at a young age. Her first big role was on “All That” in 1996, where she became popular for the “Ask Ashley” skit.

In 1999, at 13, Amanda starred in her own show, “The Amanda Show.” She later appeared in the movie “Big Fat Liar” in 2002 and the sitcom “What I Like About You” from 2002 to 2006. Amanda also starred in “What a Girl Wants” in 2003. She won multiple Nickelodeon Kids’ Choice Awards and successfully transitioned from child star to mainstream actress.

Amanda Bynes Movies and TV Shows

Amanda Bynes is a famous actress known for her roles in many movies and TV shows. She started her career on Nickelodeon with shows like “All That” and “The Amanda Show.” Amanda Bynes is known for her talent in both comedy and drama, making her a well-loved actress in both movies and TV shows.

Here’s the list of Amanda Bynes movies and tv shows.

1. She’s the Man (2006)

Summary: In this modern adaptation of Shakespeare’s “Twelfth Night,” Amanda Bynes plays Viola Hastings, a high school girl who disguises herself as her twin brother to play on the boys’ soccer team.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes delivers a hilarious and charming performance, skillfully balancing the comedic elements with moments of vulnerability as she navigates the challenges of pretending to be a boy.

Stats/Figures: “She’s the Man” grossed over $57 million worldwide and received positive reviews for Bynes’ comedic timing and the film’s modern take on the classic play.

2. Hairspray (2007)

Summary: Amanda Bynes stars as Penny Pingleton, a quirky and lovable teenager who becomes friends with Tracy Turnblad, an aspiring dancer, in 1960s Baltimore.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes shines in her role, bringing Penny to life with her infectious energy and comedic flair, particularly in her musical numbers.

Stats/Figures: “Hairspray” was a critical and commercial success, grossing over $202 million worldwide. Bynes’ performance was praised for adding depth to the ensemble cast.

3. Easy A (2010)

Summary: In this modern retelling of “The Scarlet Letter,” Amanda Bynes plays Marianne Bryant, a devout Christian high school student who spreads rumors about her classmates’ promiscuity.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes delivers a standout performance, portraying Marianne with zeal and conviction, adding a layer of humor and satire to the film’s social commentary.

Stats/Figures: “Easy A” was a box office success, grossing over $75 million worldwide. Bynes’ performance was praised for its comedic timing and sharp delivery.

4. What a Girl Wants (2003)

Summary: Amanda Bynes stars as Daphne Reynolds, a free-spirited American teenager who travels to London to meet her estranged father, a British politician.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes captivates audiences with her portrayal of Daphne, showcasing her comedic talent and endearing charisma as she navigates the challenges of fitting into her father’s world.

Stats/Figures: “What a Girl Wants” was a commercial success, grossing over $50 million worldwide. Bynes’ performance was praised for its charm and heartwarming appeal.

5. Sydney White (2007)

Summary: Amanda Bynes plays Sydney White, a college freshman who pledges a sorority but soon finds herself at odds with the popular girls on campus.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes delivers a delightful performance as Sydney, infusing the character with wit and charm, and showcasing her ability to portray a relatable and likable protagonist.

Stats/Figures: “Sydney White” received mixed reviews but was praised for Bynes’ performance and its modern twist on the classic fairy tale “Snow White.”

6. Big Fat Liar (2002)

Summary: Amanda Bynes stars as Kaylee, the best friend of a young boy named Jason, who embarks on a mission to seek revenge on a dishonest Hollywood producer who stole his story idea.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes brings humor and spunk to her role as Kaylee, providing comedic relief and serving as a supportive friend to Jason throughout their adventure.

Stats/Figures: “Big Fat Liar” was a commercial success, grossing over $52 million worldwide. Bynes’ performance was praised for her comedic timing and chemistry with her co-stars.

7. Love Wrecked (2005)

Summary: Amanda Bynes plays Jenny, a young woman who is stranded on a deserted island with her favorite rock star, whom she has been obsessing over.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes delivers a comedic and endearing performance as Jenny, showcasing her ability to bring humor and charm to the screen.

Stats/Figures: “Love Wrecked” received mixed reviews but was praised for Bynes’ performance and the film’s lighthearted and entertaining storyline.

8. Robots (2005)

Summary: Amanda Bynes provides the voice for Piper Pinwheeler, a young robot who dreams of becoming an inventor in a world populated by robots.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes’ voice work brings Piper to life, infusing the character with energy and personality, and adding to the film’s comedic elements.

Stats/Figures: “Robots” was a box office success, grossing over $260 million worldwide. Bynes’ voice work was praised for its vibrancy and comedic timing.

9. What I Like About You (2002)

Summary: Amanda Bynes stars as Holly Tyler, a teenager who moves in with her older sister in New York City, leading to a series of comedic misadventures.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes shines in her role as Holly, bringing her trademark humor and charisma to the character, and showcasing her talent for physical comedy.

Stats/Figures: “What I Like About You” was a popular TV series that ran for four seasons, showcasing Bynes’ comedic talents and earning her a dedicated fan base.

10. The Amanda Show (1999-2002)

Summary: Amanda Bynes stars in this sketch comedy series, which features various comedic sketches and characters, showcasing Bynes’ comedic range and versatility.

Bynes’ Performance: Bynes demonstrates her comedic chops in a variety of roles, from quirky characters to celebrity impressions, solidifying her status as a talented comedic actress.

Stats/Figures: “The Amanda Show” was a hit with audiences and critics alike, earning Bynes several awards and nominations for her comedic work on the show.

Also Check – Tyler Perry Movies and TV Shows

Amanda Bynes Awards and Nominations

Amanda Bynes has received several awards and nominations throughout her career, particularly during her early years as a child and teen star. Overall, Amanda Bynes’s awards and nominations reflect her popularity and talent, particularly during her early years in the entertainment industry. Her ability to connect with audiences of all ages and her comedic skills have earned her a place among the most celebrated young actresses of her generation. Here is a detailed look at some of her major accolades:

Kids’ Choice Awards: Bynes won several Kids’ Choice Awards during her tenure on “The Amanda Show” and for her roles in films like “Big Fat Liar” and “What a Girl Wants.” She was nominated for Favorite Television Actress and Favorite Movie Actress multiple times.

Teen Choice Awards: Bynes received several Teen Choice Award nominations for her work in films such as “What a Girl Wants,” “She’s the Man,” and “Hairspray.” She won the award for Choice Movie Breakout Performance – Female for her role in “What a Girl Wants” in 2003.

Young Artist Awards: As a child actress, Bynes received several Young Artist Award nominations for her roles in shows like “All That” and “The Amanda Show.” She won the award for Best Performance in a TV Comedy Series – Leading Young Actress for “The Amanda Show” in 2001.

MTV Movie Awards: Bynes received a nomination for Best Breakthrough Female Performance for her role in “She’s the Man” at the MTV Movie Awards in 2007.

Nickelodeon UK Kids’ Choice Awards: Bynes won the award for Best Movie Actress for her role in “What a Girl Wants” at the Nickelodeon UK Kids’ Choice Awards in 2004.

Conclusion

Amanda Bynes has made significant contributions to both movies and TV shows throughout her career. Starting as a child star on Nickelodeon with hits like “All That” and “The Amanda Show,” she quickly became a favorite among young audiences. Her transition to the big screen included memorable roles in films such as “Big Fat Liar,” “What a Girl Wants,” “She’s the Man,” and “Hairspray.”

As Bynes leaped to the big screen, she continued to wow viewers with her versatility, appearing in a succession of popular films like “She’s the Man,” “Hairspray,” and “What a Girl Wants.” Her ability to add depth and realism to her characters, whether in funny or serious parts, distinguishes her as a talented actress.

Amanda Bynes Movies and TV Shows – FAQs

What happened with Amanda Bynes?

Amanda Bynes faced several personal and legal issues over the years, including mental health struggles and substance abuse. She was placed under a conservatorship in 2013, similar to Britney Spears.

Why did Amanda Bynes retire?

Amanda Bynes retired from acting in 2010 because she felt overwhelmed and lost interest in the profession. She wanted to take a break to focus on her mental health and personal life.

How old was Amanda Bynes in She’s the Man?

Amanda Bynes was 19 years old when she starred in “She’s the Man” in 2006.

Why was Amanda Bynes famous?

Amanda Bynes became famous for her roles on Nickelodeon shows like “All That” and “The Amanda Show.” She was known for her comedic talent and later starred in popular movies like “What a Girl Wants,” “She’s the Man,” and “Hairspray.”

What are some of Amanda Bynes’s most popular movies?

Some of Amanda Bynes’s most popular movies include “She’s the Man,” “Hairspray,” “What a Girl Wants,” and “Easy A.”

What TV shows did Amanda Bynes star in?

Amanda Bynes starred in several TV shows, including “All That,” “The Amanda Show,” and “What I Like About You.”

Has Amanda Bynes won any awards for her performances?

Yes, Amanda Bynes has won several awards, including Nickelodeon Kids’ Choice Awards and a Blimp Award for Favorite Movie Actress.

Is Amanda Bynes returning to acting?

Yes, Amanda Bynes has expressed interest in returning to acting and has been working on new projects.

What is Amanda Bynes’s most recent project?

Amanda Bynes’s most recent project is the upcoming movie “Cruel Intentions,” in which she is set to star.
